<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPORTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/01/nfl-accused-of-racial-discrimination-in-explosive-lawsuit?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
NFL accused of racial discrimination in explosive lawsuit
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/01/nfl-accused-of-racial-discrimination-in-explosive-lawsuit?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Brian Flores" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4792fcfbd5d63380eb55fea832e2ef1756b0ab20-6350x4236.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Michael Reaves/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Brian Flores, the former head coach of the Miami Dolphins, <a href="https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/33194862/brian-flores-sues-nfl-others-former-miami-dolphins-coach-alleges-racism-hiring-practices?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sued</a> the NFL and each of its 32 teams, alleging racial discrimination in their hiring practices for Black coaches.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The suit, which was filed as a proposed class action, specifically calls out the New York Giants, Denver Broncos, and the Dolphins—the latter of which recently fired Flores after two straight winning seasons—for discriminatory practices. Some examples:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The lawsuit accuses Dolphins owner Stephen Ross of </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/brian-flores-lawsuit-racism-bill-belichick-text-messages-11643752620?mod=hp_featst_pos3" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bribing Flores</a></span><span> to have the team “tank” (offering him $100,000 for each loss) ahead of the 2019 season in order to secure a better draft pick.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Flores accused the Giants of conducting a “sham” interview with him in order to fulfill the Rooney Rule, which requires teams to interview Black applicants for open positions. The Giants responded that Flores was in the conversation “until the eleventh hour” before they went with someone else.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Flores claims that he was also not taken seriously as a candidate for the Denver Broncos head coaching position when he interviewed there. Then-general manager John Elway and others in his crew allegedly showed up to the interview an hour late and seemed like they were hungover.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Flores’s lawyers said the coach wanted to take his grievances to the legal arena in order to “shine a light on the racial injustices that take place inside the NFL.” The league has long been criticized for its lack of minority representation in its coaching ranks. Despite ~70% of the NFL’s players being Black, it currently has only one Black head coach.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In a statement, the NFL responded that “diversity is core to everything we do” and it will “defend against these claims, which are without merit.”</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What does Flores want?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Among other changes, he’s asked a judge for...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Unspecified damages.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More pay transparency for GMs, head coaches, and coordinators.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More Black people involved in the hiring process and more objectivity in the hiring/firing of coaches and front office roles.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Flores acknowledged in a statement that he is risking future career opportunities in the NFL by suing the league. “My sincere hope is that by standing up against systemic racism in the NFL, others will join me to ensure that positive change is made for generations to come,” he said.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/01/undefined?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
US road deaths reach ‘crisis’ levels
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2022/02/01/undefined?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Traffic backed up on I-95" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/cffb8b88d91c6df20cd8fd6fba14c5935ca4a27e-1024x686.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Chip Somodevilla/Getty Images</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The number of people who died in motor vehicle crashes surged to <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-business-health-transportation-pete-buttigieg-a16719e38d72f68e338030103e924cf0?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">31,720</a> in the first nine months of 2021, the government reported yesterday.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s the biggest nine-month tally in 15 years.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s also 12% higher than in the same time frame in 2020, making it the biggest percentage increase over a nine-month period since records began in 1975.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You might be thinking that the spike can be attributed to a lower number of traffic deaths in 2020, when Covid kept us indoors, but the opposite is true: US traffic fatalities that year jumped to their <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-11/road-deaths-soar-in-u-s-even-as-driving-declined?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">highest levels</a> since 2007—despite the number of vehicle-miles traveled on roads plummeting 13%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s going on? </strong>The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) has cited more reckless driving since the pandemic began, including drivers not wearing seatbelts and blowing through speed limits.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, who called the surge in road deaths a “</span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/us-road-deaths-transportation-department-cda4b0e5-eae5-4304-bbbb-682a089616cc.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">national crisis</a></span><span>,” thinks blaming humans won’t solve anything. “People make mistakes, but human mistakes don’t always have to be lethal.”</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to Buttigieg, the key to bringing down traffic deaths is a combo of redesigning roads to be safer, boosting safety standards for vehicles, and incorporating technology like automated braking into vehicles.</p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/exxon-best-profits-since-2014?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Exxon's swimming in it
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/exxon-best-profits-since-2014?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="An above ground pool filled with crude oil." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ee94e3263c11f35dafc2aff90b5eac9ff8922834-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s a reason they don’t call it Medium Oil, folks. Fueled by soaring energy prices, Exxon Mobil reported annual profits of $23 billion last year—the company's <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/01/business/exxon-earnings-4q-2021.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">largest total</a> since 2014.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Exxon’s 2021 gain is a full 180 from its 2020 performance, when the company lost $22.4 billion as demand for oil collapsed.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Things are looking up for the entire sector thanks to a rebound in energy consumption as governments tapered Covid measures. Exxon’s competitor, Chevron, also recently posted its most profitable year since 2014 when it put $15.6 billion in the bank.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’ll they do with the money?</strong> Well for one, keep producing oil and gas. In the Permian Basin of West Texas, Exxon plans to increase oil production by 25% in 2022. The company is also saying “thx” to investors who stuck around, announcing plans to buy back as much as $10 billion in shares over the next two years.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The S&P 500 energy sector is up about 23% so far in 2022, compared to the broader index, which is down about 5% on the year.</span></li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And the climate? </strong>In January, Exxon pledged to reduce or offset emissions from its operations to zero by 2050—though that doesn’t include most of the emissions associated with the company, which come from its products actually being used.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/key-performance-indicators-february-2?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
Key performance indicators
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/key-performance-indicators-february-2?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="Bill Murray in 'Groundhog Day'" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/905c72245d5657c9e40b59e334127a976f5304bd-900x512.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Columbia Pictures</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“This is one time where television really fails to capture the true excitement of a large squirrel predicting the weather.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bill Murray enthusiastically wishes all of you a Happy Groundhog Day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Employees at 54 Starbucks stores across 19 states are <a href="https://www.npr.org/2022/01/31/1076978207/starbucks-union-push-spreads-to-54-stores-in-19-states?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">petitioning to unionize</a>, just weeks after baristas formed the first union at a corporate-owned location in Buffalo. Talk about a chain reaction. <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/drum-with-drumsticks_1f941.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The new hire who showed up is not the same person we interviewed. (<a href="https://www.askamanager.org/2022/01/the-new-hire-who-showed-up-is-not-the-same-person-we-interviewed.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ask a Manager</a>)</p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
WORK
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/working-from-home-saves-employees-time?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}">
<font color="#000000">
WFH looks like a win-win
</font>
</a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/working-from-home-saves-employees-time?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew&mid={{md5(profile.email)}}" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of an upholstered blue couch with an old computer and keyboard sitting on it. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/1112c83f3dafb16d4dfe846ade794cf4961e0a98-1500x1000.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a><span class="source" style="display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px"><small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small></span>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even if you feel guilty about the occasional <em>Mario Kart</em> grand prix during an all-staff meeting, working from home is proving to be a benefit to both employees and employers. The <a href="https://qz.com/2119734/us-workers-gain-six-hours-a-week-when-they-wfh/?utm_source=email&utm_medium=daily-brief&utm_content=bab54d41-8343-11ec-b56d-a620050ba3c7" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">latest results</a> of a monthly survey of 4,000 US workers provide a few interesting insights about WFH.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The January survey, which polled workers aged 20 to 64, showed:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Remote workers save about one full hour every day by not commuting.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Another 10 minutes is saved by skipping grooming tasks like showering, shaving, and putting on makeup.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So, while rolling out of bed and opening Slack may <em>feel</em> disgusting, it’s actually nearing peak human efficiency.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But, the benefit isn’t just for workers who get to avoid buying button-downs at Nordstrom Rack: Of those 70 daily minutes saved, about 30 minutes are spent working, which tacks on an additional two and a half hours onto the workweek. And employees don’t seem to mind the extra labor, as the average worker plans to stay remote for two days a week even after the pandemic ends.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Two bonus stats: </strong>1) About 10% fewer people use an alarm clock when WFH and 2) workers who commute spend about 28 minutes getting ready, compared to 19 minutes for remote employees.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Brian Flores\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/4792fcfbd5d63380eb55fea832e2ef1756b0ab20-6350x4236.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" style=\"display:inline-block;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMichael Reaves/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBrian Flores, the former head coach of the Miami Dolphins, \u003ca href=\"https://www.espn.com/nfl/story/_/id/33194862/brian-flores-sues-nfl-others-former-miami-dolphins-coach-alleges-racism-hiring-practices?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esued\u003c/a\u003e the NFL and each of its 32 teams, alleging racial discrimination in their hiring practices for Black coaches.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe suit, which was filed as a proposed class action, specifically calls out the New York Giants, Denver Broncos, and the Dolphins—the latter of which recently fired Flores after two straight winning seasons—for discriminatory practices. Some examples:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe lawsuit accuses Dolphins owner Stephen Ross of \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/brian-flores-lawsuit-racism-bill-belichick-text-messages-11643752620?mod=hp_featst_pos3\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebribing Flores\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to have the team “tank” (offering him $100,000 for each loss) ahead of the 2019 season in order to secure a better draft pick.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFlores accused the Giants of conducting a “sham” interview with him in order to fulfill the Rooney Rule, which requires teams to interview Black applicants for open positions. The Giants responded that Flores was in the conversation “until the eleventh hour” before they went with someone else.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFlores claims that he was also not taken seriously as a candidate for the Denver Broncos head coaching position when he interviewed there. Then-general manager John Elway and others in his crew allegedly showed up to the interview an hour late and seemed like they were hungover.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFlores’s lawyers said the coach wanted to take his grievances to the legal arena in order to “shine a light on the racial injustices that take place inside the NFL.” The league has long been criticized for its lack of minority representation in its coaching ranks. Despite ~70% of the NFL’s players being Black, it currently has only one Black head coach.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn a statement, the NFL responded that “diversity is core to everything we do” and it will “defend against these claims, which are without merit.”\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat does Flores want?\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmong other changes, he’s asked a judge for...\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eUnspecified damages.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore pay transparency for GMs, head coaches, and coordinators.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore Black people involved in the hiring process and more objectivity in the hiring/firing of coaches and front office roles.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eFlores acknowledged in a statement that he is risking future career opportunities in the NFL by suing the league. “My sincere hope is that by standing up against systemic racism in the NFL, others will join me to ensure that positive change is made for generations to come,” he said.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe number of people who died in motor vehicle crashes surged to \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/coronavirus-pandemic-business-health-transportation-pete-buttigieg-a16719e38d72f68e338030103e924cf0?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e31,720\u003c/a\u003e in the first nine months of 2021, the government reported yesterday.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s the biggest nine-month tally in 15 years.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s also 12% higher than in the same time frame in 2020, making it the biggest percentage increase over a nine-month period since records began in 1975.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou might be thinking that the spike can be attributed to a lower number of traffic deaths in 2020, when Covid kept us indoors, but the opposite is true: US traffic fatalities that year jumped to their \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-11-11/road-deaths-soar-in-u-s-even-as-driving-declined?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehighest levels\u003c/a\u003e since 2007—despite the number of vehicle-miles traveled on roads plummeting 13%.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s going on? \u003c/strong\u003eThe National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) has cited more reckless driving since the pandemic began, including drivers not wearing seatbelts and blowing through speed limits.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eBut Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg, who called the surge in road deaths a “\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/us-road-deaths-transportation-department-cda4b0e5-eae5-4304-bbbb-682a089616cc.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enational crisis\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e,” thinks blaming humans won’t solve anything. “People make mistakes, but human mistakes don’t always have to be lethal.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to Buttigieg, the key to bringing down traffic deaths is a combo of redesigning roads to be safer, boosting safety standards for vehicles, and incorporating technology like automated braking into vehicles.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"An above ground pool filled with crude oil.\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/ee94e3263c11f35dafc2aff90b5eac9ff8922834-1500x1000.jpg?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan class=\"source\" Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere’s a reason they don’t call it Medium Oil, folks. Fueled by soaring energy prices, Exxon Mobil reported annual profits of $23 billion last year—the company's \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2022/02/01/business/exxon-earnings-4q-2021.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elargest total\u003c/a\u003e since 2014.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eExxon’s 2021 gain is a full 180 from its 2020 performance, when the company lost $22.4 billion as demand for oil collapsed.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThings are looking up for the entire sector thanks to a rebound in energy consumption as governments tapered Covid measures. Exxon’s competitor, Chevron, also recently posted its most profitable year since 2014 when it put $15.6 billion in the bank.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’ll they do with the money?\u003c/strong\u003e Well for one, keep producing oil and gas. In the Permian Basin of West Texas, Exxon plans to increase oil production by 25% in 2022. The company is also saying “thx” to investors who stuck around, announcing plans to buy back as much as $10 billion in shares over the next two years.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe S\u0026P 500 energy sector is up about 23% so far in 2022, compared to the The \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/2119734/us-workers-gain-six-hours-a-week-when-they-wfh/?utm_source=email\u0026utm_medium=daily-brief\u0026utm_content=bab54d41-8343-11ec-b56d-a620050ba3c7\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elatest results\u003c/a\u003e of a monthly survey of 4,000 US workers provide a few interesting insights about WFH.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe January survey, which polled workers aged 20 to 64, showed:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eRemote workers save about one full hour every day by not commuting.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnother 10 minutes is saved by skipping grooming tasks like showering, shaving, and putting on makeup.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSo, while rolling out of bed and opening Slack may \u003cem\u003efeel\u003c/em\u003e disgusting, it’s actually nearing peak human efficiency.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut, the benefit isn’t just for workers who get to avoid buying button-downs at Nordstrom Rack: Of those 70 daily minutes saved, about 30 minutes are spent working, which tacks on an additional two and a half hours onto the workweek. And employees don’t seem to mind the extra labor, as the average worker plans to stay remote for two days a week even after the pandemic ends.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTwo bonus stats: \u003c/strong\u003e1) About 10% fewer people use an alarm clock when WFH and 2) workers who commute spend about 28 minutes getting ready, compared to 19 minutes for remote employees.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS
